ygData.subject: 401 vs. 403 with authenticated users
ygData.msgSnippet: This is specific to HTTP, but this seems like a good forum for it. I have a URI that is restricted to certain authenticated users.  I an unauthenticated user

This is specific to HTTP, but this seems like a good forum for it.  

I hav=
e a URI that is restricted to certain authenticated users.  I an unauthenti=
cated user attempted a GET, clearly it should respond with a 401.  However,=
 if an authenticated user attempts to GET, but that user is not permitted t=
o access that resource, is that a 403? The spec says that "Authorization wi=
ll not help and the request SHOULD NOT be repeated."  If the user is alread=
y authenticated, it is true that retrying the request will not work, howeve=
r, if the user tries to re-authenticate with different credentials, he woul=
d be allowed to GET the resource.

So is there a cut and dry answer? If not=
, is there a widely accepted convention?


--Apple-Mail-37--939057196
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Content-Type: text/html;
	charset=us-ascii

<html><head></head><body style="word-wrap: break-word; -webkit-nbsp-mode: space; -webkit-line-break: after-white-space; ">This is specific to HTTP, but this seems like a good forum for it.  <div><br></div><div>I have a URI that is restricted to certain authenticated users.  I an unauthenticated user attempted a GET, clearly it should respond with a 401.  However, if an <i>authenticated</i> user attempts to GET, but that user is not permitted to access that resource, is that a 403? The spec says that "Authorization will not help and the request SHOULD NOT be repeated."  If the user is already authenticated, it is true that retrying the request will not work, however, if the user tries to re-authenticate with different credentials, he would be allowed to GET the resource.<div><br></div><div>So is there a cut and dry answer? If not, is there a widely accepted convention?<br>
<br></div></div></body></html>
--Apple-Mail-37--939057196--
